turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Look, it's really none of my business but why don't you just dump this guy?

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: It's not that easy.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Don't tell me, down deep he's really not a bad person and you don't want to see him get hurt.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Who the fuck are you, Dr. Joyce Brothers?  I hate the son-of-a-bitch.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Then leave.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: You don't understand.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: There's nothing to understand. The guy is a pig.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: I can't leave.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You get off on abuse or something?

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Then why don't you leave?  Just give me one good reason.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Because he'll kill me.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Why don't you call the cops?

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Why? They don't hold him for more than a day or two.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: That's long enough to get out of town.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: I can't. I've got a kid.  She lives with my parents.  Quincey knows where they live.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Then make sure he gets put away for longer.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Oh. Hi.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: What happened to your eye?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Turns out I'm allergic to steel-toed boots. Go figure.  By the way, I'm not looking for a matching set.  Where's Quincey?

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Don't worry. He's out of town.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: How far out of town?

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Trust me. We're safe.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Miles Davis. "All Blues."

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Never heard of him.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Just a fucked-up guy who played beautiful music.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Like you?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Nah. I'm strictly minor league... except for the fucked-up part.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Dude played his soul right out the end of the horn. No false notes. Always honest.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: And you admire that?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: It's the only way to play.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Is that how you play?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I try.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: : What are you up to?

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What do you want from me, Colette?

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: I don't want anything. Why are you so suspicious?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: It gets me through the day.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: You really need to lighten up.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Look, I can't help you with Quincey if that's what you're after.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: This has nothing to do with him.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: So you're just attracted to me, is that it?

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Yes. Why do you find that so hard to believe?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: How much time do you have?

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: What is wrong with you?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: How much time do you have?

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: You've got a comeback for everything, don't you, Danny? You use 'em like some sort of shield.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Who the fuck are you? Dr. Joyce Brothers?

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: There you go again. You're nothing but false notes.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You don't like the tune, find another station.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: What are you hiding, Danny?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Therapy session is over.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: You think you're the only one down here with a sad story?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No. But I'm the only one with my sad story.  And that's how it's gonna stay.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: It's me.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'm kind of busy.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Please open the door, Danny.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: We been through that.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What about a battered woman's shelter? You can move you kid in with you.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: I need my paycheck.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You can still work.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: He knows where I work.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Find a new job.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: It's not that easy. I just got a raise. I need the money.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You always been this stubborn?

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: From day one.  I was a breach birth. They tried for hours to turn my little butt around. But I wouldn't let 'em.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Ass first into the world.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: I been that way ever since.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I just can't. Okay?

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: What's wrong, Danny?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Look, maybe you oughta' leave.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: No. I want to know what the hell is going on.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I can't tell you.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No, you're wrong, I tried to tell myself the same thing but I could have gotten up. I could have done something.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: They would have killed you too.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Nothing could be worse then this slow death I'm living now.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Really, I don't want to.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I want to do this for you.  I want to do something good for a change.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Never mind. Just do what I say. He holds out the baggie. Colette backs away.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: I don't want to.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Will you do that?  Then I want you to get out of the room.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Don't worry about it. Just go across the street and watch. You'll know when it's safe to go back.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You're good, princess. I'll give you that.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: Danny, it's not what you think.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Colette, go.

turns.speaker: COLETTE
turns.text: I don't want to leave you.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Your daughter needs you.  Go.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I knew that if these were the guys I was looking for, I'd have to set up a deal so sweet, they wouldn't be able to walk away from it.

turns.speaker: TRAHN
turns.text: That's when he called me. He told me his story and he pitched me a plan.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: These guys are smart. I knew they wouldn't hit a deal unless they knew all the players. I needed a big buyer.

turns.speaker: TRAHN
turns.text: How you holding up?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'm fine. Little nervous...little disappointed that I didn't finish this myself.

turns.speaker: TRAHN
turns.text: Hey, you did the right thing. You wouldn't have stood a chance against these boys by yourself. They have eaten your ass alive.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Oh shit

turns.speaker: TRAHN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Can you do me a favor? This girl I know, her boyfriend's a real piece of shit-dude's really jamming her up. I promised her I'd try to help.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: It's Tom.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: All right, Nancy, how'd you track me down?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Billy Sutcliffe said he saw you at a bar down in Gardena a few weeks ago. Said you looked so bad, he barely recognized you.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Closure? How do you find closure when her killers are still running around out there?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I found forgiveness in my heart for the people who killed my daughter. I gave my grief to Jesus Christ.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Is that what you want me to do?  Put it all on Jesus?  Let him sort it out in the afterlife?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: You've got to deal with this sooner or later, Tom. You can't keep hiding.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Maybe I am dealing with it.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I know it's not my place to pass judgement on you but ...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'm genuinely happy that you found some peace, Nancy. But you can't forgive for Liz.  No one can.  And you can't forgive for me.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Your hatred makes them stronger and you weaker.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I don't buy that. There's a place for hatred.  Did you know that Liz and I got into an argument the night she was killed? I acted like an ass and I never had a chance to apologize to her.  Do you know what that feels like?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: It's not too late to show her you're sorry.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: How the hell did we get this detail?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Guess it's our turn.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What time is it?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Twelve

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Midnight?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Where to?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I know a guy.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Lead the way.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Nice day

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I hadn't noticed.  I've seen you around.  What's your name?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Jimmy.  Everyone calls me Jimmy the Finn.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Why's that?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: My features. They're Finnish.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You don't say.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Finland is a country.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Well, Jimmy the Finn, let's go score some gack.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Nice dealer you got there, Jimmy.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Oh ... that.  Ah, he was just juiced. He wouldn't have did nothin'

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I'm hurting.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You on a roll?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Was.  I'm on the fucking ghost train right now, man.  You got anything for me?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Why does it have to feel so bad?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You're brain is in reverse mode ... cutting off your supply of dopamine. Here.  Have a beer.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: That's a good one.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I'm serious, dude.  You always seem to be on top of things, even when you're tweakin'.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I guess there's just no substitute for good genes.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: So, why'd you want to see me?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Business.  I need to leave town and I find myself in dire need of some cash.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: See that?  That's just what I'm talking about.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You. You're smooth. You use words like dire and shit.  You got language skills, man.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Don't get carried away.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I find myself in dire need of some cash.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You remember that guy you told me about ... said he could handle a big hook-up?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yeah, Pooh-Bear.  Dude is a big-time cook. I'm talking dire.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I know a buyer.  Guy's looking for a quarter's worth.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: A quarter?  Danny that ain't even worth ...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: A quarter of a million, Jimmy.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Fuuuuuck

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Can your man handle that?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I think so.  I mean, we'd have to talk to him.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Can you set that up?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'm getting a 10% finder's fee from my man if I can get the right price.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Jimmy, where do you find these people?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: The Del Ammo Mall mostly.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You wanna score some go-fast?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Not tonight.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Hey, why do you need a gun and a vest anyway?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Personal protection. It's a dangerous world we live in, Jimmy, a very dangerous world.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You know, Jimmy, you might as well put a sign on the back of this thing asking the cops to pull you over.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You mean, like to throw 'em off?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah, that's what I mean.  Where the hell does this guy live anyway?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Palmdale

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Why do they call him Pooh-Bear?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I think on account of his nose.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You're going to have to explain that one.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: He doesn't have one.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You're going to have to give me a little more than that, Jimmy.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You ever see Queen Elizabeth sleep?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: No  You think she's a tweaker?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You want a hit?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No. I'm good.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Can I ask you something?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Sure, Jimmy.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: What does J.F.K. stand for?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: John Fitzgerald Kennedy.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Was he the president?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yes, Jimmy

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Danny?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yes, Jimmy.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Thanks for not laughing at me.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Tem thousand dollars. Everything I could spare.  It's for you.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: But why? You only owe me five. And that's not till after we close the deal tonight.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You aren't coming with me.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Okay

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Wait till I tell you what it is.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: It don't matter. I'll do it. And you sure as hell don't have to pay me.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You're my best friend, man. I'd do anything for you.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Jimmy, look, there's something I have to tell you.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Hey, check it out...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What the hell is that?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: It's you! I didn't have a picture or nothin' so I had to describe you to the guy. Not bad though, huh?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'm not a tweaker.  I don't use drugs. I never had.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: But...I've seen you.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: When? When did you ever see me use?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: This isn't like that Queen Elizabeth question, is it?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You ever notice how I always showed up, in the middle of a binge? Left before it was over? How I sneak away for cap-naps? How when the crank came around to me, I always said I'd just done one?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: No one ever noticed?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Are you kidding me? A bunch of amped -out tweakers? It was easy.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: But... why? Why would you pretend?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I can't tell you.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You don't trust me?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I don't trust anybody.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: And you want me to do you some big favor?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Wait  If you don't trust me, why did you tell me that stuff about not using drugs?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Because I don't want to see you end up like Kujo and those other losers.  I thought that maybe if you knew that I didn't use, you might see it in yourself to go clear.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I don't know... a little. I wish you would have let me in on it from the beginning.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'm sorry. I couldn't.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Nah... I want to keep it.  Maybe I can use it for like, inspiration ...you know...like when I detox?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Good for you Jimmy.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Wouldn't be a favor if you were paying me. I'll just take my five when the deal is done.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You're a good man. Jimmy the Finn.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Then why don't I see any pictures Of me up there?

turns.speaker: VERNE
turns.text: That was my idea.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You never did like me much, did you Verne?  And you can't stand it that I walked out of there alive and Liz didn't. You think I'm a coward, don't you?

turns.speaker: VERNE
turns.text: By not disgracing her memory!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: VERNE
turns.text: You might as well be spitting on her grave every time you put drugs up your nose.  Or did you just conveniently forget that it was drug dealers who killed my daughter?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You don't understand.

turns.speaker: VERNE
turns.text: Understand what?

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: I'm gonna get this developed and send it to the Warren Commission.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Um, I think the Warren Commission has been closed for a while.

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: No shit?  Fuck it.  I'll send it to Oliver Stone then. He'll get them to reopen the bastard.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah, I uh, have a buyer who's looking for about a quarter's worth.

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Crank or glass?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: The good stuff.  Can you handle that?

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: I'm sorry.  Would you like a taste?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No, I'm good.

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: I insist. It's delicious. Just a taste.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Not bad.

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Secret recipe.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Can we talk price?

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Make me an offer.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I don't know, 14,000 a kilo?

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: I deal in U.S. pounds, friend. None of that faggot metric crap for me.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Okay ... How about um .. 6,000 a ounce.

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Hey, okay.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You're serious?

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Anything for a dear friend.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: But I just met you.

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: But you're a friend of Jimmy's. I think of you as a brother already.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: So that's 40 lbs. at 6 a pound then?

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: If you say so.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Pooh-Bear, I don't mean to be rude, but I get the feeling you aren't taking me seriously.

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Maybe you're the one who isn't taking me seriously.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Why do you say that?

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: I welcome you here with open arms and you got the nerve to low-ball me like some slick used car salesman.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Hey, I was just trying to ...

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: I want to tell you about the last guy who tried to jam me up on a deal.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Hey, I don't play that.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You want to do this some other time?

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Pull your pants down.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'm sorry?

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Pull your motherfucking pants down.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Come on, guys ...

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Big Bill.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Pooh-Bear. come on, man.  What is this?  It's me, Danny. I thought we had a deal.

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Big Bill

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Captain Steubing thinks you might work for the police.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Don't address me.  I didn't make the accusation.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Please .. I don't know what you're ...

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Uh-uh-uh ...

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Shoot him.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Okay! Okay!

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Now get talkin'

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I didn't fucking do anything! I swear to God!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: CAN I PULL MY FUCKING DICK OUT?!

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I ought to just call this whole thing off right now.

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Don't do that. Please.  Or I'll kill you.  Please, Danny.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What the hell was that? Who told you I was five-0?

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: No one. It was just a test. I need to be sure of who I'm dealing with from time-to-time.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Did it ever occur to you that someone might cop to something they didn't do rather than have their balls chewed off by a rabid weasel?

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: I'll keep that in mind.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What the hell is this?

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Just some buddies.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: This is bullshit.  You didn't say anything about anybody else being here.

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: What the fuck are you gonna do about it, dickhead?

turns.speaker: POOH-BEAR
turns.text: Cool it. We got business.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah, dickhead.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I've got a hot one.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: You go, boy.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: If it's all the same to you, I'd rather not dish right here in the middle of Crankville.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Feeling the paranoia tonight, are we?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Well, you know what they say, just because you're paranoid, doesn't mean everyone's not out to slice your balls off and shove 'em down your throat.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: You got a name?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Bobby, rhymes with hobby.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Never mind.  Dude had a backfull of jailhouse tatts.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: No last name?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: It was all pretty informal.  Didn't have a lot of time to exchange pleasantries.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah. Pretty sure.  Oh yeah ... he had a spear gun, too.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: God damn, Flynne, you are one observant tweaker.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Somebody has to help you lazy bastards.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Danny, I'm touched.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Don't be. I'm worried about the kid.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You think I'm a Judas?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Hard to compare the people you're taking down with the Lord.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Garcetti thinks I'm a pile of shit.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Garcetti thinks everything is shit. He doesn't even like dolphins.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Thanks for not judging me.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: It's not my place.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Don't you wonder why I do it?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: The money? The drugs? Keeping yourself out of jail? I know the drill.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You don't find that repugnant?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Just the way the world works.  Look, as far as tweakers go, you aren't a bad guy.  You never hurt anyone but yourself as far as I know.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Tell that to Bobby ... and his wife and kid.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Bobby laid his own tracks.  He could have gone quietly but he played the hard-ass con till the end. And as far as I'm concerned, he wife and kid are a hell of a lot better off without him.  Now take the money.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: I was getting to it.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Tell me what?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: If he finds out it's me, I'm a dead man.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Danny, he isn't gonna find out it's you.  Domingo was a slinger, he must have sold to hundreds of different people.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Look, we'll talk to the A.D.A.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Soon. I promise.  We'll get the charges dropped and you can disappear.  In the mean time, trust me, he has no idea that you ratted him out.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What the hell are you doing here?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Question is, what are you doing here?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I was trying to score some dope.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Cut the shit, Flynne.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Someone want to tell me what the hell is going on here?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Okay, asshole, you wanna play, we'll play.
